intro: Tithymalus hebecarpus, commonly known as the hairy tithymalus, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and compound leaves. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are finely divided and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its common name. Tithymalus hebecarpus is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
